intro: Uragoga subrubra, commonly known as the red-stemmed uragoga, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of the family. Uragoga subrubra is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
